title: Blockchain
summary: A blockchain is a 'distributed ledger with growing lists of records (blocks) that are securely linked together via cryptographic hashes.' Each block contains transaction data, a timestamp, and a hash of the previous block, creating a chain resistant to alteration. Blockchains are typically managed by peer-to-peer networks using consensus algorithms, and were first created by Satoshi Nakamoto in 2008 for Bitcoin cryptocurrency transactions.

factual.claim: Bitcoin blockchain file size grew from 20 GB in 2014 to over 200 GB by 2020
In 2021, Bitcoin used more electricity than Argentina
Blockchain can be used in supply chain tracking for industries like diamond mining

interpretive.statement: Blockchain is seen as a 'pivotal technological advancement of the 21st century'
Private blockchains may be 'more decentralized and secure' than public ones
Blockchain could transform financial transactions by enhancing 'data storage, process simultaneous transactions'
